intro: Horkelia puberula, commonly known as the hairy horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers that bloom in the spring. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as grasslands and meadows. Horkelia puberula is often found in the Pacific Northwest and parts of California.
